name: Zone
overview:
This class allows you interact with Compute Engine.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/compute.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloud— we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var gce = gcloud.compute({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Zone
methods.description: A Zone object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine zone.

examples.code: var zone = gce.zone('us-central1-a');

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check if the zone exists.

examples.code: zone.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get a zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Get the zone's metadata.

examples.code: zone.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: autoscaler
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine autoscaler in this zone.

examples.code: var autoscaler = zone.autoscaler('autoscaler-name');

methods.name: createAutoscaler
methods.description: Create an autoscaler in this zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.coolDown
params.description: • The number of seconds that the autoscaler should wait before it starts collecting information from a new instance. Alias for config.autoscalingPolicy.coolDownPeriodSec.

params.name: config.cpu
params.description: • The target CPU utilization that the autoscaler should maintain, between 1 - 100. Alias for config.autoscalingPolicy.cpuUtilization.utilizationTarget.

params.name: config.loadBalance
params.description: • Backend capacity utilization that autoscaler should maintain, between 1 - 100. Alias for config.autoscalingPolicy.loadBalancingUtilization.utilizationTarget.

params.name: config.maxReplicas
params.description: • The maximum number of instances that the autoscaler can scale up to. Alias for config.autoscalingPolicy.maxNumReplicas.

params.name: config.minReplicas
params.description: • The minimum number of replicas that the autoscaler can scale down to. Alias for config.autoscalingPolicy.minNumReplicas.

params.name: config.target
params.description: • The name of the managed instance group that this autoscaler will scale.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createDisk
methods.description: Create a persistent disk in this zone.

examples.caption: Create a persistent disk using the latest Ubuntu version as the source image.
Create a persistent disk using the latest Ubuntu version from your project as the source image.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.os
params.description: • Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See this list of accepted OS names.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createInstanceGroup
methods.description: Create an instance group in this zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.ports
params.description: • A map of names to ports. The key should be the name, and the value the port number. Maps to options.namedPorts.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createVM
methods.description: Create a virtual machine in this zone.

examples.caption: Create a new instance using the latest Debian version from your project as the source image for a new boot disk.
Create a new instance using the latest Debian version as the source image for a new boot disk.
The above object will auto-expand behind the scenes to something like the following. The Debian version may be different when you run the command.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.networkInterfaces
params.description: • An array of configurations for this interface. This specifies how this interface should interact with other network services, such as connecting to the internet. Default: [ { network: 'global/networks/default' } ]

params.name: config.machineType
params.description: • The machine type resource to use. Provide only the name of the machine, e.g. n1-standard-16. Refer to Available Machine Types. Default: n1-standard-1

params.name: config.os
params.description: • Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See this list of accepted OS names.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: disk
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine disk in this zone.

examples.code: var disk = zone.disk('disk1');

methods.name: getAutoscalers
methods.description: Get a list of autoscalers from this zone.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.filter
params.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this can be a regular expression.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getAutoscalersStream
methods.description: Get a list of compute/autoscaler objects from this zone as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See compute/zone#getAutoscalers for a complete list of options.

methods.name: instanceGroup
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine instance group.

examples.code: var instanceGroup = zone.instanceGroup('my-instance-group');

methods.name: machineType
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine machine type.

examples.code: var machienType = zone.machineType('g1-small');

methods.name: operation
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine zone operation.

examples.code: var operation = zone.operation('operation-1445532685163-8b137d2a-1822afe7');

methods.name: vm
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine virtual machine instance.

examples.code: var vm = zone.vm('vm-name');
